job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Longmont, CO
pros: Small department and you get to know most doctors well.
cons:
MEAN staff! Extreme cliches and unless you are a absolute entitled person or sicko that is obsessed with farting and rudeness, you won’t make it there. They will make up lies and hold you to standards they themselves don’t follow. The hazing was ruthless and passive-aggressive. A smile to your face but knives in your back. I once got in trouble for helping respond to a code, saving a patient’s life, but missed a room needing to be cleaned. The gaslighting and lies were a disgrace to patient care and are a risk to patient safety. The person who did this accidentally admitted she was trying to “get me fired.” 

They also don’t follow national AORN policy with counting practices and haze and abuse anyone who questions the laziness. Some Nurses don’t participate in initial counts, and get aggressive if they are asked to. The worse thing? Management protects the lazy people and does not hold them accountable for basic safety. They are a microscopic, limited, tiny and dying hospital... but think their toxic culture is the gold standard. Avoid!avoid! avoid! if you care about safety and doing your job in the scrub role appropriately and safely.

review_title: Great place to work with excellent leadership
pros:
The senior management team is very transparent with mid level managers.  They "get it" when it comes to what is most important.  HR does a good job of keeping pay fair and in line with the industry across all jobs.

The best part is that LUH is an independent, non-profit institution.  This allows agility in leadership that allow managers the ability to change the organization for the better.  Coming from a much larger company where creating change was next to impossible, I really appreciate this.
cons: As an independent hospital there is limited growth opportunities.  Larger hospitals or health systems might offer opportunities to grow to a higher level.
